author: By Aurelien Breeden

abstract: Secretary of State Marco Rubio was visiting Guyana amid ExxonMobil’s oil production there. Venezuela has asserted claims to a large region of the country. Mr. Rubio later flew to Suriname.
title: Rubio Vows ‘Consequences’ if Venezuela Tries Seizing Territory From Guyana
author: By Edward Wong

abstract: The president said he wanted the New York Republican to stay in Congress to bolster the party’s slim House margin and protect her seat.
title: Trump Asks Stefanik to Withdraw Bid to Be U.N. Ambassador
author: By Annie Karni and Maggie Haberman

abstract: The left-leaning political party is seeking to avoid a repeat of 2021, when its top candidates were also-rans in the Democratic mayoral primary in New York City.
title: How to Beat Cuomo and Adams? The Working Families Party Has a Plan.
author: By Maya King

abstract: Pete Hegseth & Co. weren’t chosen for their competence.
title: Trump’s Crackerjack Cabinet Is a Fiasco Foretold
author: By Frank Bruni

abstract: Ro Khanna, who represents Silicon Valley, sees the vice president —  a likely heir to President Trump’s political movement — as a unique threat to the constitutional order.
title: The Progressive Congressman Who Wants to Take On JD Vance
author: By Shane Goldmacher

abstract: President Trump’s vow to hit the global automotive industry with new duties risks raising inflation and inflaming trade-war tensions.
title: Tariff Sticker Shock
author: By Andrew Ross Sorkin, Ravi Mattu, Bernhard Warner, Sarah Kessler, Michael J. de la Merced, Lauren Hirsch and Edmund Lee
